verses.verse: The Blessedness of Answered Prayer A Psalm. A Song (Deut. 20:5) at the dedication of the house of David. [1] I will extol You, O LORD, for You have (Ps. 28:9) lifted me up, And have not let my foes (Ps. 25:2) rejoice over me.
O LORD my God, I cried out to You, And You (Ps. 6:2; 103:3; (Is. 53:5)) healed me.
O LORD, (Ps. 86:13) You brought my soul up from the grave; You have kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.
(Ps. 97:12) Sing praise to the LORD, you saints of His, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
For (Ps. 103:9; Is. 26:20; 54:7, 8) His anger is but for a moment, (Ps. 63:3) His favor is for life; Weeping may endure for a night, But joy comes in the morning.
Now in my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved.”
LORD, by Your favor You have made my mountain stand strong; ((Deut. 31:17; Ps. 104:29; 143:7)) You hid Your face, and I was troubled.
I cried out to You, O LORD; And to the LORD I made supplication:
“What profit is there in my blood, When I go down to the pit? ((Ps. 6:5)) Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your truth?
Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me; LORD, be my helper!”
(Eccl. 3:4; Is. 61:3; Jer. 31:4) You have turned for me my mourning into dancing; You have put off my sackcloth and clothed me with gladness,
To the end that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
